  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Medical Doctor",
  "description": "Waaxaa is a human-centric, open knowledge platform evolving into a global education-focused encyclopedia designed to function like an open university for the world. Beyond documenting people, places, and ideas, Waaxaa serves as a learning ecosystem where knowledge is created, reviewed, and shared collaboratively for public education and lifelong learning.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Medical Doctor

Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities


	Provide quality medical care and clinical services
	Diagnose, treat, and manage patients according to best practices
	Maintain accurate medical records
	Collaborate with other healthcare professionals to improve patient outcomes


Qualifications &amp; Requirements


	Candidates should possess an MBBS or equivalent medical degree
	Completion of Housemanship
	Completion of NYSC
	Valid Practicing License
	Strong clinical, communication, and ethical skills.
",

Medical Doctor Job at Waaxaa




        
    

        
        Waaxaa is a human-centric, open knowledge platform evolving into a global education-focused encyclopedia designed to function like an open university for the world. Beyond documenting people, places, and ideas, Waaxaa serves as a learning ecosystem where knowledge is created, reviewed, and shared collaboratively for public education and lifelong learning.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Medical Doctor

Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Provide quality medical care and clinical services
	Diagnose, treat, and manage patients according to best practices
	Maintain accurate medical records
	Collaborate with other healthcare professionals to improve patient outcomes


Qualifications & Requirements


	Candidates should possess an MBBS or equivalent medical degree
	Completion of Housemanship
	Completion of NYSC
	Valid Practicing License
	Strong clinical, communication, and ethical skills.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Finance Supervisor",
  "description": "DreamWorks Global Logistics Limited - We link manufacturers with numerous customers in over 100 cities and villages across Nigeria, getting their products to them seamlessly and rapidly. We have a precise customer-focused strategy that addresses our customers&rsquo; supply chain requirements seamlessly. We know how to deliver!

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Finance Supervisor

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos&nbsp;
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	We are looking for an experienced and detail-oriented Finance Supervisor to join our team.
	The Finance Supervisor will oversee and manage the financial operations, including budgeting, forecasting, financial reporting, and compliance with regulatory requirements.
	The ideal candidate will have a strong analytical background, excellent communication skills, and the ability to contribute to strategic decision-making processes.


Job Responsibilities


	Oversee and manage all financial aspects of the company, including budgeting, forecasting, and financial analysis.
	Prepare and present financial statements, reports, and recommendations to senior management and stakeholders.
	Ensure timely and accurate month-end and year-end closing of financial records.
	Monitor cash flow and manage working capital to maintain the financial health of the company.
	Develop and manage budgets, ensuring alignment with organizational goals and objectives.
	Conduct variance analysis and provide insights to help improve financial performance.
	Coordinate with internal and external auditors to ensure proper financial controls and compliance.
	Manage financial planning, including the preparation of financial projections and long-term forecasting.
	Ensure compliance with tax regulations and manage tax reporting and filing.
	Provide guidance and leadership to junior finance team members.
	Identify opportunities for cost savings, efficiency improvements, and financial risk management.
	Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in financial management.


Qualifications


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor&#39;s Degree with 3-6years of experience.
	ICAN qualification/ Professional stage in ICAN is compulsory
	Proven experience as a Finance Supervisor, Financial Controller, or in a similar role.
	Strong understanding of financial management principles, accounting practices, and regulatory requirements.
	Proficiency in financial software and Microsoft Excel, QuickBooks, and other accounting software.
	Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
	Ability to manage multiple priorities.


Salary
N350,000 - N400,000 / month.

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV&nbsp;to:&nbsp;dglhrexecutive@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position and location (Lagos)&nbsp;as the subject of the mail.",
  "datePosted": "2026-01-03",
  "validThrough": "2026-01-24",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "DreamWorks Global Logistics"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Lagos",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "PropertyValue",
    "name": "",
    "value": "192485"
  },
  "baseSalary": {
    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 250000,
      "maxValue": 400000,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Finance Supervisor Job at DreamWorks Global Logistics Limited




        
    

        
        DreamWorks Global Logistics Limited - We link manufacturers with numerous customers in over 100 cities and villages across Nigeria, getting their products to them seamlessly and rapidly. We have a precise customer-focused strategy that addresses our customers’ supply chain requirements seamlessly. We know how to deliver!

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Finance Supervisor

Job Location: Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

            
    




	We are looking for an experienced and detail-oriented Finance Supervisor to join our team.
	The Finance Supervisor will oversee and manage the financial operations, including budgeting, forecasting, financial reporting, and compliance with regulatory requirements.
	The ideal candidate will have a strong analytical background, excellent communication skills, and the ability to contribute to strategic decision-making processes.


Job Responsibilities


	Oversee and manage all financial aspects of the company, including budgeting, forecasting, and financial analysis.
	Prepare and present financial statements, reports, and recommendations to senior management and stakeholders.
	Ensure timely and accurate month-end and year-end closing of financial records.
	Monitor cash flow and manage working capital to maintain the financial health of the company.
	Develop and manage budgets, ensuring alignment with organizational goals and objectives.
	Conduct variance analysis and provide insights to help improve financial performance.
	Coordinate with internal and external auditors to ensure proper financial controls and compliance.
	Manage financial planning, including the preparation of financial projections and long-term forecasting.
	Ensure compliance with tax regulations and manage tax reporting and filing.
	Provide guidance and leadership to junior finance team members.
	Identify opportunities for cost savings, efficiency improvements, and financial risk management.
	Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in financial management.


Qualifications


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor's Degree with 3-6years of experience.
	ICAN qualification/ Professional stage in ICAN is compulsory
	Proven experience as a Finance Supervisor, Financial Controller, or in a similar role.
	Strong understanding of financial management principles, accounting practices, and regulatory requirements.
	Proficiency in financial software and Microsoft Excel, QuickBooks, and other accounting software.
	Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
	Ability to manage multiple priorities.


Salary
N350,000 - N400,000 / month.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: dglhrexecutive@gmail.com using the Job Position and location (Lagos) as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply  
        

    
     




        
        

            
    




   


    
        Similar Jobs

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Human Resource Manager",
  "description": "DreamWorks Global Logistics Limited - We link manufacturers with numerous customers in over 100 cities and villages across Nigeria, getting their products to them seamlessly and rapidly. We have a precise customer-focused strategy that addresses our customers&rsquo; supply chain requirements seamlessly. We know how to deliver!

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Human Resource Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos Mainland,&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Human Resource Manager to join our team.
	As the HR Manager, you will be responsible for overseeing all aspects of human resources practices and processes.
	You will support business needs and ensure the proper implementation of the company&#39;s strategy and objectives.


Responsibilities


	Develop and implement HR strategies and initiatives aligned with the overall business strategy
	Bridge management and employee relations by addressing demands, grievances, or other issues
	Manage the recruitment and selection process
	Support current and future business needs through the development, engagement, motivation, and preservation of human capital
	Develop and monitor overall HR strategies, systems, tactics, and procedures across the organization
	Nurture a positive working environment
	Oversee and manage a performance appraisal system that drives high performance
	Maintain pay plan and benefits program
	Assess training needs to apply and monitor training programs
	Report to management and provide decision support through HR metrics
	Ensure legal compliance throughout human resource management.


Requirements


	B.Sc. Degree in Human Resources or related field; a Master&rsquo;s degree in HR management will be a plus
	Must be a female
	Proven working experience as an HR Manager or other HR Executive roles
	People-oriented and results-driven.
	Demonstrable experience with human resources metrics
	Knowledge of HR systems and databases
	Ability to architect a strategy, along with leadership skills
	Excellent active listening, negotiation, and presentation skills
	Competence to build and effectively manage interpersonal relationships at all levels of the company
	In-depth knowledge of labor law and HR best practices.


Salary
N300,000 monthly.

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;dglhrexecutive@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position and location as the subject of the mail.",

  "validThrough": "2026-02-01",

Human Resource Manager Job at DreamWorks Global Logistics Limited




        
    

        
        DreamWorks Global Logistics Limited - We link manufacturers with numerous customers in over 100 cities and villages across Nigeria, getting their products to them seamlessly and rapidly. We have a precise customer-focused strategy that addresses our customers’ supply chain requirements seamlessly. We know how to deliver!

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resource Manager

Job Location: Lagos Mainland, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Human Resource Manager to join our team.
	As the HR Manager, you will be responsible for overseeing all aspects of human resources practices and processes.
	You will support business needs and ensure the proper implementation of the company's strategy and objectives.


Responsibilities


	Develop and implement HR strategies and initiatives aligned with the overall business strategy
	Bridge management and employee relations by addressing demands, grievances, or other issues
	Manage the recruitment and selection process
	Support current and future business needs through the development, engagement, motivation, and preservation of human capital
	Develop and monitor overall HR strategies, systems, tactics, and procedures across the organization
	Nurture a positive working environment
	Oversee and manage a performance appraisal system that drives high performance
	Maintain pay plan and benefits program
	Assess training needs to apply and monitor training programs
	Report to management and provide decision support through HR metrics
	Ensure legal compliance throughout human resource management.


Requirements


	B.Sc. Degree in Human Resources or related field; a Master’s degree in HR management will be a plus
	Must be a female
	Proven working experience as an HR Manager or other HR Executive roles
	People-oriented and results-driven.
	Demonstrable experience with human resources metrics
	Knowledge of HR systems and databases
	Ability to architect a strategy, along with leadership skills
	Excellent active listening, negotiation, and presentation skills
	Competence to build and effectively manage interpersonal relationships at all levels of the company
	In-depth knowledge of labor law and HR best practices.


Salary
N300,000 monthly.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: dglhrexecutive@gmail.com using the Job Position and location as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

Job Position: Production Supervisor
Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos

	OND/HND/B.Sc. in Food Science, Catering, Hospitality Management or a related field
	Minimum of 3 years in a similar role within a food production or restaurant setting

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Social Media Coordinator & Administrator",
  "description": "OVM Consulting Service -&nbsp;Our client, a growing company dedicated to bridging gaps within the digital coworking space, is&nbsp;recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Social Media Coordinator &amp; Administrator
Job Location:&nbsp;Ketu, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Working Schedule:&nbsp;5 days a week (3 days On-site and 2 days Remote)

Job Summary


	Our client is seeking a reliable and professional Social Media coordinator &amp; administrator to join her dynamic team to increase brand awareness, engagement, and audience growth while supporting overall marketing goals.


Key Responsibilities


	Plan, create, schedule, and publish content across social media platforms (Facebook, Instagram, X, TikTok, LinkedIn).
	Monitor and respond to comments, messages, and mentions professionally.
	Maintain and manage a content calendar aligned with organizational goals.
	Ensure brand voice, tone, and visual consistency across all platforms.
	Track social media performance and stay updated with trends and platform changes.
	Managing online, in-person, and phone bookings
	Processing payment transactions
	Providing printing services
	Maintaining records of daily visitors
	Managing office internet/network systems.


Requirements


	Must reside within a reasonable distance of Ketu / Shangisha, Lagos.
	Must be tech savvy and proficient in the use of all social media platforms.
	Proficient in Microsoft Office applications
	Strong knowledge of Windows based systems.
	Minimum qualification of OND, HND, BSC, or equivalent.
	Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
	Strong problem-solving abilities
	Ability to work independently with minimal supervision.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CVto:&nbsp;ovmrecruitment@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

  "validThrough": "2026-02-01",

  },

Social Media Coordinator & Administrator Job at OVM Consulting Service




        
    

        
        OVM Consulting Service - Our client, a growing company dedicated to bridging gaps within the digital coworking space, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Social Media Coordinator & Administrator
Job Location: Ketu, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Working Schedule: 5 days a week (3 days On-site and 2 days Remote)

Job Summary


	Our client is seeking a reliable and professional Social Media coordinator & administrator to join her dynamic team to increase brand awareness, engagement, and audience growth while supporting overall marketing goals.


Key Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Plan, create, schedule, and publish content across social media platforms (Facebook, Instagram, X, TikTok, LinkedIn).
	Monitor and respond to comments, messages, and mentions professionally.
	Maintain and manage a content calendar aligned with organizational goals.
	Ensure brand voice, tone, and visual consistency across all platforms.
	Track social media performance and stay updated with trends and platform changes.
	Managing online, in-person, and phone bookings
	Processing payment transactions
	Providing printing services
	Maintaining records of daily visitors
	Managing office internet/network systems.


Requirements


	Must reside within a reasonable distance of Ketu / Shangisha, Lagos.
	Must be tech savvy and proficient in the use of all social media platforms.
	Proficient in Microsoft Office applications
	Strong knowledge of Windows based systems.
	Minimum qualification of OND, HND, BSC, or equivalent.
	Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
	Strong problem-solving abilities
	Ability to work independently with minimal supervision.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CVto: ovmrecruitment@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.
